elements.content: In this work, we report two 3,8-connected nets. The first one is polymers 1−3, La(pydc)(L)0.5(µ-H2O) (pydc = pyridine-2,5-carboxylate, H2L = adipic acid), which are isostructural and described by the (4·5·6)2(42·56·616·72·82) topology notation, and the other one is polymer 4, Co3(1,4-BDC)(1,2-BDC)2(µ2-H2O)2(µ-H2O)2 (1,4-BDC = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate, 1,2-BDC = 1,2-benzenedicarboxylate), characterized by the tfz-d net with the (43)2(46·618·84) topology symbol. Comparing with the reported 3,8-connected nets, the present examples show several unique properties: (a) the La2- and Co3-based MBBs are unprecedented; (b) two different multicarboxylate ligands are employed to construct such nets; (c) the 3D matrix of polymers 1−3 is unique and unprecedented.
elements.clean_text: In this work, we report two 3,8-connected nets. The first one is polymers 1-3, La(pydc)(L)0.5(µ-H2O) (pydc = pyridine-2,5-carboxylate, H2L = adipic acid), which are isostructural and described by the (4⋅5⋅6)2(42⋅56⋅616⋅72⋅82) topology notation, and the other one is polymer 4, Co3(1,4-BDC)(1,2-BDC)2(µ2-H2O)2(µ-H2O)2 (1,4-BDC = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate, 1,2-BDC = 1,2-benzenedicarboxylate), characterized by the tfz-d net with the (43)2(46⋅618⋅84) topology symbol. Comparing with the reported 3,8-connected nets, the present examples show several unique properties: (a) the La2- and Co3-based MBBs are unprecedented; (b) two different multicarboxylate ligands are employed to construct such nets; (c) the 3D matrix of polymers 1-3 is unique and unprecedented.

elements.content:
Two 3,8-connected nets were prepared by La2- or Co3-based molecule building blocks.

Introduction

The synthesis of coordination polymers has developed rapidly in recent years. Work along this line is motivated by their interesting molecular topologies and crystal packing motifs, along with their potential applications as functional materials. Especially in the field of metal−organic frameworks (MOFs), the classification and nomenclature are becoming increasingly important issues as more and more examples of 3D nets are obtained, or deliberately synthesized. Usually, such systems mainly focus on the highly symmetric building blocks with the basic or uninodal connectivity of 3, 4, 6, and the resulting high symmetry nets such as srs, dia, pcu. Examples of five-, seven-, and eight-connected MOFs are relatively scarce, and especially, MOFs with twelve-connected connectivity are highly rare, not only due to the limited coordination numbers of metal centers, but also due to the steric hindrance of organic ligands. Therefore, in order to achieve such high-connected MOFs, we usually employ MBBs (molecule building blocks) to perform high connectivity. On the other hand, recently, the exploration and design of binodal MOFs appear to be another hot topic, especially, Zaworotko, Lah, and their co-workers pioneered the construction of a 3,24-connected binodal net by SBBs (supermolecular building blocks). Therefore, it is suggested that, in this field, the present research should be focused on the following subjects: (a) exploring undeveloped topological framework; (b) exploring new MBBs or SBBs; (c) utilizing functional MBBs or SBBs (such as luminescence- or magnetism-based MBBs or SBBs) to construct functional topological MOFs. Herein, as an ongoing work in the design and construction of topological architecture, we report two 3,8-connected nets. The synthesis, structure, luminescence, and magnetic properties in detail are discussed below.

elements.content: Commercially available reagents are used as received without further purification. Elemental analysis for C, H, and N was performed on a Perkin-Elmer 240 analyzer. Steady-state photoluminescence spectra were measured on a SHIMADZU RF-5301PC spectrofluorophotometer. Magnetic measurements were carried out with a Quantum Design (SQUID) magnetometer MPMS-XL-5.
elements.clean_text:
Experimental Section

Materials and Physical Measurements

Commercially available reagents are used as received without further purification. Elemental analysis for C, H, and N was performed on a Perkin-Elmer 240 analyzer. Steady-state photoluminescence spectra were measured on a SHIMADZU RF-5301PC spectrofluorophotometer. Magnetic measurements were carried out with a Quantum Design (SQUID) magnetometer MPMS-XL-5.

elements.content: A mixture of La(ClO4)3, H2pydc, and H2L in the ratio of 1:1:0.5 was added to 10 mL of deionized water, and its pH was controlled in the range 4−5 with 1 mol/L NaOH solution. After the mixture was stirred for 30 min, it was placed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined reactor and heated at 170 °C in an oven for 3 days and then slowly cooled to room temperature. Block crystals of 1−3 were obtained (yield ca. 65% based on Eu, 58% based on Tb, and 73% based on Pr). Elemental analysis for 1 (%): calcd C 29.50, H 2.23, N 3.44; found C 29.53, H 2.32, N 3.32. For 2: calcd C 29.00, H 2.19, N 3.38; found C 29.11, H 2.25, N 3.31. For 3: calcd C 30.32, H 2.29, N 3.54; found C 30.41, H 2.12, N 3.61.
elements.clean_text:
Synthesis of 1-3

A mixture of La(ClO4)3, H2pydc, and H2L in the ratio of 1:1:0.5 was added to 10 mL of deionized water, and its pH was controlled in the range 4-5 with 1 mol/L NaOH solution. After the mixture was stirred for 30 min, it was placed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined reactor and heated at 170 °C in an oven for 3 days and then slowly cooled to room temperature. Block crystals of 1-3 were obtained (yield ca. 65% based on Eu, 58% based on Tb, and 73% based on Pr). Elemental analysis for 1 (%): calcd C 29.50, H 2.23, N 3.44; found C 29.53, H 2.32, N 3.32. For 2: calcd C 29.00, H 2.19, N 3.38; found C 29.11, H 2.25, N 3.31. For 3: calcd C 30.32, H 2.29, N 3.54; found C 30.41, H 2.12, N 3.61.

elements.content:
Note! Although we did not encounter any danger during these experiments, caution is required, when perchlorate is used for synthesis.

Synthesis of 4

A mixture of CoCl2, 1,4-H2BDC, and 1,2-H2BDC in a ratio of 1.5:1:1 with the pH = 7 adjusted by NaOH (1 mol/L) solution, was sealed in a Teflon reactor, and heated at 170 °C for three days, and then cooled to room temperature at 3 °C/h. Subsequently, purple crystals were obtained in 72% yield based on Co. Element analysis (%) for 1: calcd C 38.89, H 2.72; found C 38.91, H 2.71. The phase purity of the crystal samples is confirmed by XRD research (Figure S1, ).

Synthesis of 4

elements.content: Suitable single crystals of 1−4 were selected and mounted in air onto thin glass fibers. Accurate unit cell parameters were determined by a least-squares fit of 2θ values, and intensity data were measured on a Rigaku R-AXIS RAPID IP area diffractometer with Mo Kα radiation (λ = 0.71073 Å) at room temperature. The intensities were corrected for Lorentz and polarization effects as well as for empirical absorption based on multiscan technique; all structures were solved by direct methods and refined by full-matrix least-squares fitting on F 2 by SHELX-97. All non-hydrogen atoms were refined with anisotropic thermal parameters. Crystallographic data for the three compounds are summarized in Table .
elements.clean_text:
X-ray Structural Studies

Suitable single crystals of 1-4 were selected and mounted in air onto thin glass fibers. Accurate unit cell parameters were determined by a least-squares fit of 2θ values, and intensity data were measured on a Rigaku R-AXIS RAPID IP area diffractometer with Mo Kα radiation (λ = 0.71073 Å) at room temperature. The intensities were corrected for Lorentz and polarization effects as well as for empirical absorption based on multiscan technique; all structures were solved by direct methods and refined by full-matrix least-squares fitting on F 2 by SHELX-97. All non-hydrogen atoms were refined with anisotropic thermal parameters. Crystallographic data for the three compounds are summarized in Table .

The coordinated mode of these ligands involved in this research are listed in Scheme .

La(pydc)(L)<sub>0.5</sub>(µ-H<sub>2</sub>O) (1−3)

Single-crystal X-ray diffraction analyses revealed that the three compounds are isostructural, and crystallize in the P21/c space group; thus, only the structure of 1 is representatively described in detail here. In 1, each Eu(III) ion holds the EuNO8, tricapped trigonal-prism geometry, completed by four pydc oxygen atoms, three L oxygen atoms, one pydc nitrogen atom, as well as one terminal water molecule. The Eu−N bond length of 2.781 Å is obviously longer than the Eu−O bond lengths in the range of 2.456−2.672 Å, due to the difference of N, O atom radii. A similar phenomenon is also observed in 2 and 3. The two carboxyl groups of L show the µ2:η2:η1 coordinated mode, while those of pydc give the µ2:η1:η1 coordinated fashion (Scheme ). As shown in Figure , the Eu1 and symmetry-related Eu1A are bridged by two pydc carboxyl groups in the µ2:η1:η1 mode and two L carboxyl groups in the µ2:η2:η1 fashion, thus leading to the Eu2-based MBB of edge-sharing tricapped trigonal-prism polyhedra with the Eu−Eu distance of 4.154 Å and Eu−O−Eu angle of 108.14°, and each Eu2-based MBB connects to six pydc ligans and two L ligands in eight directions, while each pydc ligand links to three Eu2-based MBBs in three directions; whereas each L ligand only bridges two Eu2-based MBBs. Therefore, we can consider each Eu2-based MBB and pydc ligand to be 8- and 3-connected nodes, respectively. Topology analysis by topos40 program suggests the (3,8)-connected net with the (4·5·6)2(42·56·616·72·82) topology symbol. On the other hand, if the L linkers are not counted into, then this framework can be described to be a (3,6)-connected rutile net where the Eu2-based MBBs and pydc ligands act as 6- and 3-connected nodes, respectively.
elements.clean_text:
Results and Discussion

Description of Crystal Structures

The coordinated mode of these ligands involved in this research are listed in Scheme .

La(pydc)(L)0.5(µ-H2O) (1-3)

Single-crystal X-ray diffraction analyses revealed that the three compounds are isostructural, and crystallize in the P21/c space group; thus, only the structure of 1 is representatively described in detail here. In 1, each Eu(III) ion holds the EuNO8, tricapped trigonal-prism geometry, completed by four pydc oxygen atoms, three L oxygen atoms, one pydc nitrogen atom, as well as one terminal water molecule. The Eu-N bond length of 2.781 Å is obviously longer than the Eu-O bond lengths in the range of 2.456-2.672 Å, due to the difference of N, O atom radii. A similar phenomenon is also observed in 2 and 3. The two carboxyl groups of L show the µ2:η2:η1 coordinated mode, while those of pydc give the µ2:η1:η1 coordinated fashion (Scheme ). As shown in Figure , the Eu1 and symmetry-related Eu1A are bridged by two pydc carboxyl groups in the µ2:η1:η1 mode and two L carboxyl groups in the µ2:η2:η1 fashion, thus leading to the Eu2-based MBB of edge-sharing tricapped trigonal-prism polyhedra with the Eu-Eu distance of 4.154 Å and Eu-O-Eu angle of 108.14°, and each Eu2-based MBB connects to six pydc ligans and two L ligands in eight directions, while each pydc ligand links to three Eu2-based MBBs in three directions; whereas each L ligand only bridges two Eu2-based MBBs. Therefore, we can consider each Eu2-based MBB and pydc ligand to be 8- and 3-connected nodes, respectively. Topology analysis by topos40 program suggests the (3,8)-connected net with the (4⋅5⋅6)2(42⋅56⋅616⋅72⋅82) topology symbol. On the other hand, if the L linkers are not counted into, then this framework can be described to be a (3,6)-connected rutile net where the Eu2-based MBBs and pydc ligands act as 6- and 3-connected nodes, respectively.

elements.content: The single crystal X-ray diffraction analysis of 4 shows that polymer 4 crystallizes in the P2/c, monoclinic space group. The coordination sphere of the metal centers is listed below: Co1 shows the six-coordinated CoO6 octahedral geometry completed by O1, O2, O4 from 1,2-BDC, O5 from 1,4-BDC, and O7, O8 of water molecules; similarly, Co2 located on an inversion center adopts the same CoO6 octahedral geometry completed by O1, O1A, O3, O3A from 1,2-BDC, and O7, O7A of water molecules. The Co−O bond lengths are in the range of 2.025−2.187 Å, comparable with that observed in other Co(II)-containing compounds. Notably, there are two kinds of coordinated water molecules, H2O(8) as terminal ligands and H2O(7) as bridging ligands. The 1,2-BDC and 1,4-BDC ligands afford µ5:η2:η1:η1:η1 and µ2:η1:η0:η0:η1 coordinated modes, respectively (Scheme ).

Co3(1,4-BDC)(1,2-BDC)2(µ2-H2O)2(µ-H2O)2 (4)

The single crystal X-ray diffraction analysis of 4 shows that polymer 4 crystallizes in the P2/c, monoclinic space group. The coordination sphere of the metal centers is listed below: Co1 shows the six-coordinated CoO6 octahedral geometry completed by O1, O2, O4 from 1,2-BDC, O5 from 1,4-BDC, and O7, O8 of water molecules; similarly, Co2 located on an inversion center adopts the same CoO6 octahedral geometry completed by O1, O1A, O3, O3A from 1,2-BDC, and O7, O7A of water molecules. The Co-O bond lengths are in the range of 2.025-2.187 Å, comparable with that observed in other Co(II)-containing compounds. Notably, there are two kinds of coordinated water molecules, H2O(8) as terminal ligands and H2O(7) as bridging ligands. The 1,2-BDC and 1,4-BDC ligands afford µ5:η2:η1:η1:η1 and µ2:η1:η0:η0:η1 coordinated modes, respectively (Scheme ).

elements.content: The primer cobalt atoms are in turn connected to give rise to the isosceles triangle Co3-based MBB, where Co1, Co2 are bridged by one µ2-H2O molecule and one carboxyl group with the Co−Co distance of 3.261 Å and Co−O−Co angles of 98.21° for Co1−O7−Co2, 98.11° for Co1−O1−Co2; the Co1, Co2, and symmetry-related Co1A are associated together by two carboxyl groups, together with the Co1−Co1A distance of 4.941 Å. In literature, the records of MOFs built on linear or equilateral triangle Co3-base MBBs have been documented; by contrast, hitherto, there is not a precedent containing such an isosceles triangle Co3-based MBB observed in 1 (Figure ).

elements.content: As illustrated in Figure , the assembly of cobalt atoms, water molecules, as well as 1,2-BDC constructs a 2D net, which are further supported by the 1,4-BDC pillars, thus creating the 3D pillar-layered frameworks. The distance between adjacent sheets is ca. 11 Å.

elements.clean_text: 3  View of the (3,8)-connected layer-pillared tfz-d architecture of 4 and its schematic description.

elements.content: Better insight into the nature of this intricate framework can be achieved by the application of a topological approach. As shown in Figure , each Co3-based MBB connects six 1,2-BDC ligands and two other Co3-based MBBs to give the eight connectivity, while each 1,2-BDC ligand links three Co3-based MBBs to afford the three connectivity; then, we can consider the Co3-based MBBs and 1,2-BDC ligands to be the 8- and 3-connected nodes, respectively. And the succeeding topology analysis by topos40 program suggests the (3,8)-connected net with the (43)2(46·618·84) topology symbol (Figure ). Interestingly, in 1−3, if the connectors of L are not considered, then the 3,6-connected rutile net is formed; whereas in 4, without the consideration of the 1,4-BDC connectors, the 3,6-connected CdI-like net is built.
elements.clean_text: Better insight into the nature of this intricate framework can be achieved by the application of a topological approach. As shown in Figure , each Co3-based MBB connects six 1,2-BDC ligands and two other Co3-based MBBs to give the eight connectivity, while each 1,2-BDC ligand links three Co3-based MBBs to afford the three connectivity; then, we can consider the Co3-based MBBs and 1,2-BDC ligands to be the 8- and 3-connected nodes, respectively. And the succeeding topology analysis by topos40 program suggests the (3,8)-connected net with the (43)2(46⋅618⋅84) topology symbol (Figure ). Interestingly, in 1-3, if the connectors of L are not considered, then the 3,6-connected rutile net is formed; whereas in 4, without the consideration of the 1,4-BDC connectors, the 3,6-connected CdI-like net is built.

elements.content: In the literature, there are six records characterized by a (3,8)-connected net: three records belong to the (3,8)-connected the-type net with (43)2(48·64·812·104) topological symbol; two cases are ascribed to be tfz-d or (tfz-d)-related net with (43)2(46·618·84) or (43)2(46·614·88) topological notation; and one example named as NJU affords the (4·62)2(42·622·7·83) topological notation. Within them, the ratio of 3-, 8-connected nodes is 2:1. The the-type net comprises one kind of edge, and its 3-, 8-connected nodes are alternately connected, while the other cases own two kinds of edges and besides the alternately connected 3-, 8-connected nodes, the 8-connected nodes are also directly associated together. Comparing with them, it is clear that polymer 4 is a tfz-d net, and the net of polymers 1−3 is close to NJU, but with different topological notation, viz., (4·5·6)2(42·56·616·72·82) for 1−3 vs (4·62)2(42·622·7·83) for NJU. Thereby, the topology structure of 1−3 is unique and unprecedented. Furthermore, among the reported examples, the Co4-, Mn4-, Fe4-, Co3- (linear), Cd3-based (isosceles triangle), or rod-shaped Zn−O−C MBBs (observed in the reported tfz-d net) are employed as 8-connected nodes; whereas in the present research, two new MBBs, viz., La2- and Co3-based MBBs, are developed. Especially, the isosceles triangle Co3-based MBB is also different from the isosceles triangle Cd3-based MBB observed in the (tfz-d)-related net: the arrangement of the Cd3-based MBB is isosceles triangle, but in fact, the two symmetrical Cd(II) centers are not associated together and largely separated by ca. 6.731 Å, thus, the definition of pseudo(isosceles triangle) Cd3-based MBB is more suitable; whereas in the present one, the two symmetrical Co(II) centers are associated together by two carboxyl groups and only separated by ca. 4.941 Å. In addition, we also find that the reported the and tfz-d net is constructed by one kind of ligand, and the (tfz-d)-related net and NJU contain two kinds of ligands, viz., multicarboxylate plus neutral bipyridine ligands; by contrast, the present cases are built by two kinds of multicarboxylate lignads, viz., one chelating ligand and one linear ligand. Therefore, it is believed that the present research results have largely developed 3,8-connected nets and will bring us a new synthesis approach to access 3,8-connected or other kinds of nets. The comparison of these 3,8-connected nets in detail is listed in Table .

Taking into account the excellent luminescent properties of Eu(III) and Tb(III), the solid luminescence of 1 and 2 was studied. When excited at 360 nm for 1 and 330 nm for 2, they emit strong red luminescence (1) and green luminescence (2) at room temperature (Figure ). These emission spectra exhibit the characteristic transition of Eu(III) or Tb(III) ion. The emission peaks of the complexes correspond to the 5D0−7F n (n = 0, 1, 2) transitions in 1, i.e. 580 nm (5D0−7F0), 589 and 594 nm (5D0−7F1), 614 and 619 nm (5D0−7F2), and 5D4−7F n (n = 6, 5, 4, 3) transitions in 2, i.e. 490 nm (5D4−7F6), 544 nm (5D4−7F5), 584 nm (5D4−7F4) and 620 nm (5D4−7F3). The most intense transition is 5D0−7F2 for 1 and 5D4−7F5 for 2, which implies red and green emission light, respectively. In addition, the selection of excitation wavelengths of 360 nm for 1 and 330 nm for 2 is based on the considerations of the most intense transition of them, which are also comparable with those observed in other Eu (or Tb)-containing MOFs.

Luminescence Properties

Taking into account the excellent luminescent properties of Eu(III) and Tb(III), the solid luminescence of 1 and 2 was studied. When excited at 360 nm for 1 and 330 nm for 2, they emit strong red luminescence (1) and green luminescence (2) at room temperature (Figure ). These emission spectra exhibit the characteristic transition of Eu(III) or Tb(III) ion. The emission peaks of the complexes correspond to the 5D0-7F n  (n = 0, 1, 2) transitions in 1, i.e. 580 nm (5D0-7F0), 589 and 594 nm (5D0-7F1), 614 and 619 nm (5D0-7F2), and 5D4-7F n  (n = 6, 5, 4, 3) transitions in 2, i.e. 490 nm (5D4-7F6), 544 nm (5D4-7F5), 584 nm (5D4-7F4) and 620 nm (5D4-7F3). The most intense transition is 5D0-7F2 for 1 and 5D4-7F5 for 2, which implies red and green emission light, respectively. In addition, the selection of excitation wavelengths of 360 nm for 1 and 330 nm for 2 is based on the considerations of the most intense transition of them, which are also comparable with those observed in other Eu (or Tb)-containing MOFs.

elements.content: The χM T product of crystal samples of 4 has been measured in the temperature range 2−300 K with applied magnetic fields of 500 Oe. At room temperature, the diamagnet-corrected χM T value of 6.29 cm3 K mol−1 is slightly higher than that of three high-spin Co(II) ions (5.63 cm3 mol−1 K, S = 3/2, g = 2.0) as magnetically isolated center, due in part to orbital contribution from the octahedral high-spin Co(II) ions. Upon cooling from room temperature, the χM T products (Figure ) suggest the antiferromagnetic behavior of 4, which is further supported by the 1/χM vs T plot (above 13 K, the plot is well fitted by the Curie−Weiss law (χM = C/(T− θ)), with C = 6.57 cm3 mol−1 K, θ = −13.2 K).

Upon cooling from room temperature, the χM T products (Figure ) suggest the antiferromagnetic behavior of 4, which is further supported by the 1/χM vs T plot (above 13 K, the plot is well fitted by the Curie-Weiss law (χM = C/(T- θ)), with C = 6.57 cm3 mol-1 K, θ = -13.2 K).

elements.content: In this work, via hydrothermal synthesis, the assembly of La2- or Co3-based MBBs with two kinds of multicarboxylate ligands has generated two 3,8-connected nets: polymers 1−3 present the first lanthanide-based 3,8-connected net with unprecedented (4·5·6)2(42·56·616·72·82) topology notation; and polymer 4 is a tfz-d net with (43)2(46·618·84) topology symbol. Comparing with the reported 3,8-connected nets, the present cases has several unique features: (a) new MBBs, viz., La2- and Co3-based MBBs, were developed; (b) new synthesis strategy, viz., two kinds of multicarboxylate ligands are employed to construct such a net; (c) the topology structure of 1−3 is unique and unprecedented. Therefore, it is believed that the present work has largely enriched 3,8-connected nets and will bring us a new synthesis approach to access 3,8-connected or other kinds of nets.
elements.clean_text:
Conclusion

In this work, via hydrothermal synthesis, the assembly of La2- or Co3-based MBBs with two kinds of multicarboxylate ligands has generated two 3,8-connected nets: polymers 1-3 present the first lanthanide-based 3,8-connected net with unprecedented (4⋅5⋅6)2(42⋅56⋅616⋅72⋅82) topology notation; and polymer 4 is a tfz-d net with (43)2(46⋅618⋅84) topology symbol. Comparing with the reported 3,8-connected nets, the present cases has several unique features: (a) new MBBs, viz., La2- and Co3-based MBBs, were developed; (b) new synthesis strategy, viz., two kinds of multicarboxylate ligands are employed to construct such a net; (c) the topology structure of 1-3 is unique and unprecedented. Therefore, it is believed that the present work has largely enriched 3,8-connected nets and will bring us a new synthesis approach to access 3,8-connected or other kinds of nets.

A mixture of La(ClO4)3, H2pydc, and H2L in the ratio of 1:1:0.5 was added to 10 mL of deionized water, and its pH was controlled in the range 4−5 with 1 mol/L NaOH solution. After the mixture was stirred for 30 min, it was placed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined reactor and heated at 170 °C in an oven for 3 days and then slowly cooled to room temperature. Block crystals of 1−3 were obtained (yield ca. 65% based on Eu, 58% based on Tb, and 73% based on Pr). Elemental analysis for 1 (%): calcd C 29.50, H 2.23, N 3.44; found C 29.53, H 2.32, N 3.32. For 2: calcd C 29.00, H 2.19, N 3.38; found C 29.11, H 2.25, N 3.31. For 3: calcd C 30.32, H 2.29, N 3.54; found C 30.41, H 2.12, N 3.61.

Note! Although we did not encounter any danger during these experiments, caution is required, when perchlorate is used for synthesis.

Synthesis of 4

A mixture of CoCl2, 1,4-H2BDC, and 1,2-H2BDC in a ratio of 1.5:1:1 with the pH = 7 adjusted by NaOH (1 mol/L) solution, was sealed in a Teflon reactor, and heated at 170 °C for three days, and then cooled to room temperature at 3 °C/h. Subsequently, purple crystals were obtained in 72% yield based on Co. Element analysis (%) for 1: calcd C 38.89, H 2.72; found C 38.91, H 2.71. The phase purity of the crystal samples is confirmed by XRD research (Figure S1, ).
